title: Best Gluten-Free Recipes - Easy Gluten-Free Dinner Ideas
body: <style type="text/css">#sidepanel{transform:translateX(0);visibility:visible;content-visibility:auto;}@media (max-width:425px){#sidepanel{width:7rem;max-width:7rem;}#sidepanel .nav-item,#sidepanel .nav-item a,#sidepanel footer a,#sidepanel div a,#sidepanel a span{font-size:10px;}#sidepanel ul,#sidepanel div{padding:0;margin:0;}#sidepanel button{display:none;}}</style>SearchMy RecipesSubscribeMembership BenefitsRecipesMealsHolidaysFood TrendsNewsKitchen Tips & ToolsAll VideosAbout UsNewsletterDelish ShopFollowOther EditionsYour Privacy ChoicesPrivacy NoticeTerms Of UseSkip to ContentRecipesDinnersSpring RecipesKitchen TipsNewsSubscribesign inSearchLemon Blueberry DessertsSpring SaladsCopycat Recipe IdeasBrunch RecipesSpring DinnersMeals & CookingRecipe Headquarters57 Delicious Gluten-Free Dinner Recipes The Whole Family Will Love57 Delicious Gluten-Free Dinner Recipes The Whole Family Will LoveGluten? We don't know her. By Mackenzie FilsonUpdated: Feb 22, 2023Save ArticlePHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: SPENCER RICHARDSLiving gluten-free does not mean you have to skip out on your favorites. Far from it! No surprise, we're all about having our pasta, pizza, and tacos and eating them too. So whether you're celiac, trying to accommodate party guests, or simply needing to cut out gluten, we've got plenty of amazing recipes that you'll be surprised just happen to be gluten-free (like our one-pan coconut lime chicken).  The big win? You can still eat all the best comfort foods like stuffed peppers, Instant Pot pho, and homemade gluten-free pasta without feeling like you're missing out on anything. When it comes to making gluten-free recipes, you're going to want to watch out for a couple ingredients that may seem harmless but actually contain gluten. Soy sauce, which contains gluten, comes in a gluten-free version, and you can use tamari in a pinch for all those stir-fries. Tortilla chips are nearly always gluten-free, thanks to corn as a base. Worcestershire sauce, which you'll need for our Reuben bowls, is almost always gluten-free, but do look out for malt vinegar (which does contain gluten).Now that you know what to look out for, you can get to cooking up our recipes for Instant Pot pork puttanesca, chili cheese sweet potato casserole, and feta & herb-crusted salmon. $5 says nobody even notices you made an entirely gluten-free feast!If you ever wondered what exactly is gluten and what happens to your body when you go gluten-free, we've got tons of handy guides about this mysterious protein. For more gluten-free ideas, check out all our favorite gluten-free desserts, gluten-free appetizers, gluten-free breakfasts,  and gluten-free sides. 1One-Pan Coconut-Lime ChickenPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREIf our creamy Tuscan chicken is a mainstay at your house, this recipe is going to be just the thing to shake up your weeknight dinner routine. We paired quick-cooking chicken cutlets with a spicy-sweet coconut milk sauce that‚Äôs out-of-this-world tasty. Tomatoes (and tomato paste) bring it back down to Earth, so you can make this over and over (and over!) again. Not convinced? Did we mention this comes together in just one pan, in less than 30 minutes?!Get the One-Pan Coconut-Lime Chicken recipe. 2Classic Stuffed PeppersOf all the food you can stuff, stuffed peppers are at the top of our list. Bell peppers are large enough to hold a lot, strong enough to keep their shape in the oven, and mild enough in flavor to go with just about anything. Here we‚Äôre filling them with beefy, tomato rice, and shredded Monterey Jack cheese, but you can customize them to fit your taste.Get the Classic Stuffed Peppers recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below3Cacio E Pepe Sweet Potato NoodlesPHOTO: ROCKY LUTEN; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONLooking to convert a spiralized veggie skeptic? Make them these cacio e pepe sweet potato noodles. Tossed in buttery black pepper sauce and showered with Parmesan and Pecorino, these sweet potato noodles are so delicious that no one will even think about asking for ‚Äúregular‚Äù pasta.Get the Cacio E Pepe Sweet Potato Noodles recipe.4Lemony Chicken & Potatoes With FetaPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: SPENCER RICHARDSFreshen up a classic dish, lemon chicken and potatoes, by spooning the most flavorful olive, almond, and parsley sauce over top. Prepared from the pan drippings, the sauce is so simple to make without getting out an extra pot. The best part? This entire recipe is made in just one dish, making dinner (and cleanup) easier than ever.Get the Lemony Chicken & Potatoes With Feta recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below5Feta & Herb-Crusted SalmonPHOTO: LUCY SCHAEFFER; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCERWe get it, salmon can be a little‚Ä¶ intimidating. Trust us, though‚Äîyou‚Äôve just gotta find the cooking method that works for you. One of our favorites? Covering a whole fish, rather than individual fillets, with fun toppings to add flavor all on just one sheet pan. For this Mediterranean-inspired version, you just arrange your salmon on a sheet tray (lined with foil for the easiest cleanup), sprinkle on the toppings, and bake it for 25 minutes. No flipping, no sticking, and no mess!Get the Feta & Herb-Crusted Salmon recipe. 6Creamy Gochujang White Chicken ChiliPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: SPENCER RICHARDSThis creamy, red-tinted spin on white chicken chili incorporates sweet and savory gochujang for a unique spin on a classic winter dinner. It's got lots of chili flavor without a ton of heat, meaning this can be enjoyed by everyone in the family (even the spice-averse!).Get the Creamy Gochujang White Chicken Chili recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below7Chili Cheese Sweet Potato CasserolePHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCERWith roasted sweet potatoes and black bean chili layered together under a gooey blanket of cheese, this easy vegetarian weeknight dinner is both incredibly comforting and surprisingly hearty.Get the Chili Cheese Sweet Potato Casserole recipe.8Instant Pot Pork PuttanescaPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONFor this dish, we were inspired by classic Italian puttanesca, a tomato-based dish with anchovies, capers, and olives that's traditionally served over pasta. Pork makes it extra-hearty, so we served it over creamy polenta, but feel free to sub in gluten-free pasta, rice, or whatever else you can dream up.Get the Instant Pot Pork Puttanesca recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below9Best-Ever Gluten-Free PastaParker FeierbachYes, it's TRUE! You can make amazing gluten-free pasta from scratch, and it's not even hard!Get the Best-Ever Gluten-Free Pasta recipe.  10Cheesy Chorizo, Chickpea & Crispy Rice SkilletPhotographer: Lucy Schaeffer. Food Styling: Makinze Gore.If you haven't tried crispy rice before, it'll become a staple after you try it in this recipe. Crunchy and golden, this is a great way try rice in a different, delicious way. We love it, but especially when it turns into a crust for this cheesy chorizo and chickpea filling.Get the Cheesy Chorizo, Chickpea & Crispy Rice Skillet recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below11Mushroom, Spinach & Gruy√®re Stuffed Pork TenderloinPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONThis ultra-stuffed mushroom, spinach, and Gruy√®re pork tenderloin is already jam-packed with vegetables, so we suggest pairing it with a carb-y side like our jeweled saffron rice or our best mashed potatoes.Get the Mushroom, Spinach & Gruyere-Stuffed Pork Tenderloin recipe.12Buckwheat Galettes With Ham & EggERIK BERNSTEINLike their sweet cousins, cr√™pes, galettes hail from Brittany, France. Because they're made with buckwheat flour, galettes are extra nutty, making them perfect for pairing with savory fillings for a quick dinner this fall. Here, they're filled with the classic ham, egg, and cheese combination, known as "galette compl√®te" in French, but feel free to switch it up if you like.Get the Buckwheat Galettes With Ham & Egg recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below13Marry Me ChickenPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: SPENCER RICHARDSIf you're looking for a chicken dinner so good jaws will drop, this is the recipe for you. Chicken breasts are seared until golden, before being baked with a simple (but extremely satisfying) cream sauce that results in a chicken that's packed with flavor in every bite. Whether you‚Äôre making this for your bestie or special someone for an extra-special date night get ready for sounds of pure joy after the first bite.Get the Marry Me Chicken recipe. 14Crispy Chipotle Chicken TacosAndrew buiExtra-crispy on the outside and cheesy on the inside, these tacos are so much fun to make and eat. Putting cheese directly in your skillet might sound wrong, but it works! Once off-heat, the cheese starts to harden and crisps up, giving the texture of a crunchy taco shell, but super-delicious.Get the Crispy Chipotle Chicken Tacos recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below15Tuscan Butter ShrimpParker feierbach We like using shrimp without their shells because it's easier to eat‚Äîpeeling shrimp when they're covered in sauce can get messy. If you're down for the extra work, though, leaving the shells on will lead to a more flavorful sauce. Shrimp shells provide tons of delicious seafood flavor, which is why they're often a main ingredient in seafood stock.Get the Tuscan Butter Shrimp recipe.16Halloumi SaladAndrew buiWe think it's due time that halloumi, the brined Cypriot cheese, got its time in the spotlight. Besides the delightfully squeaky texture (where the cheese curd lovers at?) and the tangy, salty flavor, the high melting point is really what makes this cheese stand out‚Äîwhen heat is applied, it develops a delicious golden crust that is so delightful in this salad.Get the Halloumi Salad recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below17Bacon & Spinach Stuffed ChickenErik bernsteinHasselback your chicken by cutting shallow slits into your chicken breasts (don't cut all the way through!) and stuff each slit with bacon and a creamy spinach and artichoke filling. It will make your weeknight chicken dinner sing! It's untraditional, but all the best meals are.Get the Bacon & Spinach Stuffed Chicken recipe.18Cauliflower Pizza CrustParker feierbach Possibly our favorite use of cauliflower as a culinary master of disguise is in pizza crust. It might sound crazy, but it can be a delicious and healthy alternative to the classic. In this easy, gluten-free pizza recipe, you're basically making cauliflower rice as base the base for your crust.Get the Cauliflower Pizza Crust recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below19Air Fryer Pork ChopsParker feierbach Most of the time, we don't get very excited over pork chops. Often overdone, they come out dry, sad, and flavorless. Cooking them in an air fryer changes all that. Due to the intense heat circulation that happens, the outside crisps slightly while the inside stays nice and juicy.Get the Air Fryer Pork Chops recipe.20Saag PaneerChopping all the baby spinach (a whole pound!) is the hardest part of this Indian recipe. To save time, microwave it first so it steams, then chop.Get the Saag Paneer recipe.Watch Next¬†Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowGluten-Free RecipesJamaican Jerk Chicken Reuben BowlsKeto Chicken ParmesanCrispy Potato Bacon, Egg & CheeseAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowSpaghetti Squash CarbonaraChia PuddingCauliflower Pizza Crust30+ Gluten-Free Christmas Cookies Keto Beef StewKeto Tortilla ChipsHalvaAir Fryer Pork ChopsAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowNewsletterSubscribeManage SubscriptionAbout UsDelish Test KitchenMedia KitCommunity GuidelinesAdvertise With UsDelish Shop Product SupportOther Hearst SubscriptionsDelish Unlimited Membership SupportTurn off Web NotificationsA Part of Hearst Digital MediaWe may earn commission from links on this page, but we only recommend products we back.¬©2025 Hearst Magazine Media, Inc. We don't know her. \u003c/p\u003e","short_title":"57 Gluten-Free Dinner Recipes","index_title":"57 Genius Gluten-Free Dinner Ideas Everyone Will Love","introductory_text":"\u003cp\u003eLiving \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/gluten-free-food-recipes/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003egluten-free\u003c/a\u003e does \u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003emean you have to skip out on your favorites. Far from it! No surprise, we're \u003cem\u003eall\u003c/em\u003e about having our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/g3176/weeknight-pasta-dinners/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003epasta\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/g269/homemade-pizza-recipes/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003epizza\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/g2786/easy-taco-recipes/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003etacos\u003c/a\u003e and eating them too. So whether you're celiac, trying to accommodate \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/entertaining/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eparty\u003c/a\u003e guests, or simply needing to cut out gluten, we've got plenty of amazing recipes that you'll be surprised just happen to be gluten-free (like our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a42676553/one-pan-coconut-lime-chicken-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eone-pan coconut lime chicken\u003c/a\u003e).  The big win? You can still eat all the best comfort foods like \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a23014857/classic-stuffed-peppers-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003estuffed peppers\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a34372692/instant-pot-pho-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eInstant Pot pho\u003c/a\u003e, \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a55824/best-gluten-free-pasta-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ehomemade gluten-free pasta\u003c/a\u003e without feeling like you're missing out on anything. \u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhen it comes to making gluten-free recipes, you're going to want to watch out for a couple ingredients that may seem harmless but actually contain gluten. \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/kitchen-tools/a37897391/soy-sauce-substitutes/\" target=\"_blank\" data-vars-ga-outbound-link=\"https://www.delish.com/kitchen-tools/a37897391/soy-sauce-substitutes/\"\u003eSoy sauce\u003c/a\u003e, which contains gluten, comes in a gluten-free version, and you can use \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/a34149820/what-is-tamari-sauce/\" target=\"_blank\" data-vars-ga-outbound-link=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/a34149820/what-is-tamari-sauce/\"\u003etamari\u003c/a\u003e in a pinch for all those \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/g965/stir-fry-meals/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003estir-fries\u003c/a\u003e. \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a35495917/baked-tortilla-chips-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\" data-vars-ga-outbound-link=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a35495917/baked-tortilla-chips-recipe/\"\u003eTortilla chips\u003c/a\u003e are nearly always gluten-free, thanks to corn as a base. Worcestershire sauce, which you'll need for our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a27326998/reuben-bowls-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eReuben bowls\u003c/a\u003e, is almost always gluten-free, but do look out for malt vinegar (which does contain gluten).\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eNow that you know what to look out for, you can get to cooking up our recipes for \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a41514065/instant-pot-pork-puttanesca-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eInstant Pot pork puttanesca\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a40871783/chili-cheese-sweet-potato-casserole-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003echili cheese sweet potato casserole\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a40871783/chili-cheese-sweet-potato-casserole-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003efeta \u0026 herb-crusted salmon\u003c/a\u003e. $5 says nobody even notices you made an entirely gluten-free feast!\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eIf you ever wondered \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/nutrition/news/a22940/what-is-gluten/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ewhat exactly is gluten\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/food/a19480917/what-happens-when-you-go-gluten-free/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ewhat happens to your body when you go gluten-free\u003c/a\u003e, we've got tons of handy guides about this mysterious protein. For more gluten-free ideas, check out all our favorite \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/g19447705/gluten-free-desserts/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003egluten-free desserts\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/g19458144/gluten-free-appetizers/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003egluten-free appetizers\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/nutrition/g770/gluten-free-breakfasts/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003egluten-free breakfasts\u003c/a\u003e,  and \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/nutrition/g2606/gourmet-gluten-free-sides-recipes-012209/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003egluten-free sides\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e","social_title":"57 Genius Gluten-Free Dinner Recipes The Whole Family Will Love","seo_meta_description":"These dinner recipe ideas have one thing in common: They're all gluten-free! Far from it! No surprise, we're all about having our pasta, pizza, and tacos and eating them too. So whether you're celiac, trying to accommodate party guests, or simply needing to cut out gluten, we've got plenty of amazing recipes that you'll be surprised just happen to be gluten-free (like our one-pan coconut lime chicken).  The big win? You can still eat all the best comfort foods like stuffed peppers, Instant Pot pho, and homemade gluten-free pasta without feeling like you're missing out on anything. When it comes to making gluten-free recipes, you're going to want to watch out for a couple ingredients that may seem harmless but actually contain gluten. Soy sauce, which contains gluten, comes in a gluten-free version, and you can use tamari in a pinch for all those stir-fries. Tortilla chips are nearly always gluten-free, thanks to corn as a base. Worcestershire sauce, which you'll need for our Reuben bowls, is almost always gluten-free, but do look out for malt vinegar (which does contain gluten).Now that you know what to look out for, you can get to cooking up our recipes for Instant Pot pork puttanesca, chili cheese sweet potato casserole, and feta \u0026 herb-crusted salmon. $5 says nobody even notices you made an entirely gluten-free feast!If you ever wondered what exactly is gluten and what happens to your body when you go gluten-free, we've got tons of handy guides about this mysterious protein. For more gluten-free ideas, check out all our favorite gluten-free desserts, gluten-free appetizers, gluten-free breakfasts,  and gluten-free sides.
